page.title: 03DAIRSIE PLACE NAMES
page.content: Osnaburgh was the old name for Dairsie. It is connected with a small village in Germany called Osnabruck. The first settlers in Dairsie were probably Germans who introduced the linen industry. The linen weavers would live in the small cottages in Main Street. Osnaburgh can still be heard in Dairsie from Osnaburgh Court and I live there. - Pauline Short The Pitcairn Institute was built in 1900 as a house by Mrs. Pitcairn. She had many books and when she dies it was used as the library and institute. It is now my Aunt's house. Until the middle thirties water was raised from a well outside the back door which was used by the householders who had no well of their own. At the back of the Institute is Pitcairn Park for which Mrs. Pitcairn paid.
